title: Clunking or Knocking Noise Over Bumps
symptom_short: Clunking or knocking noise when driving over bumps

likely_causes.cause: Worn stabilizer (sway) bar links or bushings
Worn control arm bushings or ball joints

recommended_checks: Note whether noise comes from front or rear.
Inspect sway bar links and bushings.
Have suspension inspected on a lift.
safety_warning: Severely worn suspension components can affect vehicle stability and steering control.

title: Squeaking Suspension at Low Speed
symptom_short: Squeaking or creaking noise at low speed or when turning
recommended_checks: Note if noise changes with temperature or rain.
Inspect bushings for cracking or dryness.
safety_warning: Squeaks may indicate early wear that can later affect steering safety.

title: Vehicle Bounces Excessively After Bumps
symptom_short: Car continues to bounce after hitting bumps

likely_causes.cause: Worn or leaking shock absorbers or struts

recommended_checks: Perform bounce test at each corner.
Replace shocks or struts in pairs.
safety_warning: Worn shocks reduce tire contact with the road, increasing stopping distance.

title: Vehicle Pulls or Wanders While Driving
symptom_short: Vehicle pulls to one side or wanders

likely_causes.cause: Worn suspension bushings or ball joints

safety_warning: Poor alignment and worn parts can cause loss of control at speed.

title: Uneven Ride Height or Sagging
symptom_short: One corner or side of vehicle sits lower

likely_causes.cause: Overloaded vehicle or damaged suspension mount

recommended_checks: Visually compare ride height side to side.
Inspect springs for cracks or breakage.
safety_warning: Sagging suspension can affect braking, handling, and headlight aim.
